title.narrative: Technical Training and job placement for 600 out of school youths in areas affected by the 2010 earthquake

description.narrative: 600 out of school youths will be trained in the construction and hospitality fields. Upon completion of the training, the project will accompany the trainees for 6 months as they look for economic opportunities.

Adapt IDEJEN Monitoring and Evaluation tools to respond to project needs.,Reinforce training centers in data collection and data analysis to better inform on project performance.,Elaborate regular report to inform on project progress and achievements.,Train 600 young people (50% women, 50% men) in writing, reading, mathematics and oral French during six months,Evaluate youth participants in Non formal basic education at the end of the training program.,Train 600 young people (50% women, 50% ) in lifeskills education including problem solving - hygiene - HIV/AID - Sexual Reproductive Health, etc.. during six months,Ensure placement of at least 60% of program graduates in jobs or internships.,Ensure that at least 30% of program graduates are trained in entrepreneurship., Organise counseling sessions for finishing youth on their future life project.,Support to youths that are willing to continue their schooling or further their technical training.,Train 600 young people in leadership, financial literacy and management skills and creation of classrooms youth committees. ,Organize youth leadership committees in each training center,Organize community activities by the youth leadership committees, Advocate at the level of the community leaders to facilitate youth socio- reintegration.,INFP Evaluates participants in technical fields at the end of the training program,Train 600 young people in three major technical fields (construction, hospitality, mechanics) during six months , Distribute toolkits to youth who complete the training program.,Award of INFP recognized certificates to youth who succeed the INFP final exams.
